intro: Capura purpurata, commonly known as the purple capura, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple and pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Capura purpurata thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
